about_the_game:
Blue Chips is a turn-based strategy board game where you have to survive and attain success in a severe economic world. Try to earn money from trading cryptocurrency, gold, stock exchange and real estate to buy and upgrade your business. Make your opponents bankrupt to become the best.



The map contains cells of businesses and assets. If you stand up in the business cell you are able to buy this cell. That means if another player stands up on this cell they have to pay you. Payment depends on business size and level. Business size is permanent for each business cell but level is upgradable and hold IPO. Each upgrade becomes available only if you cross this cell again.



If you stand up in an asset cell you are able to buy an asset. There are some types of assets and each type works in a different way. Use assets to earn money and manipulate the market. For example you can buy a lot of gold and all business becomes more expensive for all players including you. It's a good idea if you already have a business and you don't need to buy it.



Currency - Rises if you buy it and falls if you sell it. Rising and falling are pretty stable.
Cryptocurrency - Rises if you buy it and falls if you sell it. Rising and falling are not stable.
Stocks - Changes if any player stands up on this type of asset cell. Rising and falling are very unstable.
Gold - Rises if you buy it and doesn't fall if you sell. Affects the other assets.
Real estate - Gives you income every time you cross the start cell.
Stocks of players - Price depends on the player's total capital.
